column2: ARKANSAS PERMIT TEST
column4: Arkansas
column6: AR

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. The octagonal shape is used:
column4: for stop signs and railroad advance warning signs.
column6: to warn drivers of existing or possible hazards on roadways.
column8: exclusively for stop signs.

column2: 2. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column4: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.
column6: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.
column8: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.

column2: 3. When driving in work zones you should:
column4: gradually come to a complete stop and wait for a flagger to guide traffic safely through the work zone.
column6: tailgate the vehicle ahead.
column8: carefully watch for workers and moving equipment.

column2: 4. What is the only effective method to reduce your BAC?
column4: Eating before or while you drink.
column6: Drinking coffee.
column8: Not drinking over a period of time.

column2: 5. Any use of a cell phone while operating a motor vehicle is considered a distraction because:
column4: it draws the attention of other drivers.
column6: it causes the driver to be concerned about the latest news.
column8: it occupies the driver's mind, hands and eyes.

column2: 6. In rainy weather, drivers should be most careful when turning or stopping:
column4: when it's been raining all day.
column6: after it has been raining for at least two hours.
column8: during the first half hour of rain.

column2: 7. Having a drivers license is:
column4: a privilege.
column6: a requirement.
column8: a constitutional right.

column2: 8. When you see this sign you should:
column4: merge left.
column6: watch for traffic to the right.
column8: turn right.

column2: 9. To prevent a fatigue-related crash while driving:
column4: find a safe parking area to take a 15 to 20 minute nap.
column6: continue driving so you will reach your destination sooner.
column8: drive at night when there are not as many vehicles on the roadway.

column2: 10. A broken yellow line on your side of the roadway only means:
column4: Passing is not permitted on either side.
column6: Passing is permitted on your side of the roadway.
column8: Passing is permitted on both sides.

column2: 11. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column4: Listen to heavy metal music.
column6: Allow enough travel time to reach your destination on schedule.
column8: Adjust your schedule to drive during times with the most highway traffic.

column2: 12. What happens if two vehicles reach at the same time an intersection with four-way stop signs?
column4: The driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column6: The first vehicle to reach the intersection must yield.
column8: The driver on the right yields to the driver on the left.

column2: 13. Roads with double solid yellow lines in the center indicate that passing is:
column4: allowed only in your direction of travel.
column6: allowed in both directions.
column8: not allowed in either direction.

column2: 14. Before you change lanes, you should:
column4: check your left mirror.
column6: keep other vehicles out of your blind spots.
column8: look for other traffic by turning your head and looking behind you for oncoming traffic.

column2: 15. A vehicle is stopped at a crosswalk to permit a pedestrian to cross the roadway. The driver of the vehicle approaching from the rear should:
column4: not overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.
column6: overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.
column8: sound the horn.

column2: 16. Two drivers reach an uncontrolled intersection at the same time. Who has the right of way?
column4: No one.
column6: The driver on the right.
column8: The driver on the left.

column2: 17. When following another vehicle at night, drivers should use:
column4: high beam headlights.
column6: low beam headlights.
column8: emergency flashers.

column2: 18. Signs with orange backgrounds mean:
column4: road construction site.
column6: railroad crossing.
column8: side road ahead.

column2: 19. What should you do when an aggressive driver confronts you?
column4: Make eye contact.
column6: Challenge the aggressive driver with increased speed.
column8: Avoid eye contact with the aggressive driver.

column2: 20. Alcohol:
column4: makes it easier to make correct decisions.
column6: improves your reaction time.
column8: makes you less aware of what is happening to your driving abilities.

column2: 21. This road sign means:
column4: Low clearance
column6: Yield the right-of-way
column8: Side road

column2: 22. A flashing red light at an intersection means:
column4: Stop and yield the right of way.
column6: Stop and wait for the green light
column8: You have the right-of-way.

column2: 23. Which statement about drinking alcohol and driving is true?
column4: If you are under the legal BAC limit, your driving is not affected.
column6: Alcohol affects judgement and coordination, which are needed to drive safely.
column8: After drinking, a cold shower will sober you up.

column2: 24. If the vehicle you are driving starts to skid, you should:
column4: brake lightly.
column6: turn off the ignition.
column8: stay off the brakes.

column2: 25. What does a flashing yellow light mean?
column4: Drivers may move forward with caution.
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.
column8: All of the above.
